events.title: Battle of Karbala
events.description: The Battle of Karbala took place, where Husayn ibn Ali, the grandson of Prophet Muhammad, was killed. This event is significant in Islamic history, particularly for Shia Muslims.
events.significance: It marked a major split within Islam and is commemorated annually during Ashura.

events.title: The Knickerbocker Baseball Club Founded
events.description: The Knickerbocker Base Ball Club, one of the first organized baseball teams, was founded in New York City.
events.significance: This club formalized baseball rules and helped popularize the sport in the United States.

events.title: Chinese Revolution of 1911 Begins
events.description: The Wuchang Uprising began, marking the start of the Xinhai Revolution, which led to the fall of the Qing Dynasty and the establishment of the Republic of China.
events.significance: It ended over two thousand years of imperial rule in China.

events.title: Tokyo Summer Olympics Open
events.description: The 1964 Summer Olympics officially opened in Tokyo, Japan, the first Olympics held in Asia.
events.significance: It symbolized Japan's recovery and reintegration into the international community post-World War II.

events.title: Fiji Gains Independence
events.description: Fiji gained independence from British colonial rule, becoming a sovereign nation.
events.significance: Marked the end of colonial rule and the beginning of Fiji's self-governance.
